hymns.title: HYMN I. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: , THEE @Agni, have the #Devas, ever of one accord, sent hither down, a @Deva, appointed messenger, yea, with their wisdom sent thee down. The #Immortal, O thou Holy One, mid mortal #men, the devoted @Deva, the #wise, have they brought forth, brought forth the omnipresent devoted #Sage.

p: As such, O @Agni, bring with favour to the #Devas thy #Brother @Varuna who loveth #offering, True to the Law, the Aditya who supporteth #men, the #King, supporter of #mankind.

p: Do thou, O #Friend, turn hither him who is our #Friend, swift as a wheel, like two #car-#steeds in rapid course, Wondrous! to us in rapid course. O @Agni, find thou grace for us with @Varuna, with #Maruts who illumine all. Bless us, thou Radiant One, for seed and #progeny, yea, bless us, O thou Wondrous @Deva.

p: Do thou who knowest @Varuna, O @Agni, put far away from us the @Deva's displeasure. Best Offerer, brightest One, refulgent remove thou far from us all those who hate us.

p: Be thou, O @Agni, nearest us with assist, our closest #Friend while now this Morn is breaking. Reconcile to us @Varuna, be bounteous enjoy the gracious #juice; be swift to hear us.

p: #Excellent is the glance, of brightest #splendour, which the auspicious @Deva.bestows on mortals- The @Deva's glance, longed-for even as the butter, pure, heated, of the #cow, the #MilchCow's bounty.

p: Three are those births, the true, the most exalted, eagerly longed-for, of the @Deva, of @Agni. He came invested in the boundless region, pure, radiant, friendly, mightily resplendent.

p: This envoy joyeth in all seats of #worship, borne on his golden #car, sweet-tongued Invoker: Lovely to look on, with red #steeds, effulgent, like a feast rich in #food, joyous forever.

p: Allied by #worship, let him give #man knowledge: by an extended cord they lead him onward. He stays, effectual in this mortal's dwelling, and the @Deva.wins a share in his possessions.

p: Let @Agni -for he knows the way- conduct us to all that he enjoys of @Deva.sent #riches, what all the Immortals have prepared with wisdom, #Dyaus, Sire, begetter, raining down true blessings.

p: In houses first he sprang into existence, at great $Heaven's base, and in this region's bosom; Footless and headless, both his ends concealing, in his Bull's lair drawing himself together.

p: Wondrously first he rose aloft, defiant, in the Bull's lair, the homeof holy #Order, Longed-for, young, beautiful, and far-resplendent: and sevendear frieuds sprang up unto the #Mighty.

p: Here did our #human #fathers take their places, fain to fulfil the sacred Law of #worship. Forth drave they, with loud #call, @Dawn's teeming Milch-kine bid in the mountainstable, in the cavern.

p: Splendid were they when they had rent the mountain: others, around, shall tell forth this their exploit. They sang their #song, prepared to free the #cattle: they found the #light; with holy hymns they worshipped.

p: Eager, with thought intent upon the booty, the #men with their celestial speech threw open, the solid mountain firm, compact, enclosing, confining Cows, the stable full of #cattle.

p: The Milch-#cow's earliest name they comprehended: they found the #Mother's thrice-seven noblest titles. This the bands knew, and sent forth acclamation:with the Bull's sheen the Red One was apparent.

p: The turbid darkness fled, the $Heaven was sp, endid! up rose the bright beam of celestial #Morning. @Surya ascended to the wide expanses, beholding deeds of #men both good and evil.

p: Then, afterwards they looked around, awakened, when first they held that $Heaven allotted #treasure.. Now all the #Devas abide in all their dwellings. @Varuna, @Mitra, be the prayer effective.

p: I will #call hither brightly-beaming @Agni, the Herald, all-supporting, best at #worship. He hath disclosed, like the milch cows' pure udder, the Sorria's #juice when cleansed and poured from beakers.

p: The freest @Deva.of all who should be worshipped, the guest who is received in all #men's houses, @Agni who hath secured the #Devas’ high favour.may he be gracious, to us #Jatavedas.

hymns.title: HYMN II. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: THE, Faithful One, #Immortal among mortals, a @Deva among the #Devas, appointed envoy, Monk, best at #worship, must #shine forth in #glory . @Agni shall be raised high with #man's oblations.

p: #Born for us here this day, O #Son of Vigour, between both races of #born beings, @Agni, Thou farest as an envoy, having harnessed, Sublime One! thy #strong-muscled radiant stallions.

p: I laud the ruddy #steeds who pour down #blessing, dropping oil, flectest through the thoualit of #Order. Yoking red #horses to and fro thou goest between you #Deities and mortal races.

p: @Aryaman, @Mitra, @Varuna, and @Indra with @Visnu, of the #Devas, #Maruts and @Asvins- These, @Agni, with good #car and #steeds, bring hither, most bountiful, to folk with fair oblations.

p: @Agni, be this  'our #offering eternal, with #brave #friends, rich in kine and sheep and #horses, Rich, #Asura! in sacred #food and children, in full assembly, #wealth broad-based and during.

p: The #man who, sweating, brings for thee the fuel, and makes his head to ache, thy faithful servant. @Agni, to him be a self-#strong Protector guard him from all who seek to do him mischief.

p: Who brings thee #food, though thou hast #food in plenty, welcomes his cheerful guest and speeds him onward, who kindles thee devoutly in his dwelling,to him be #wealth secure and freely giving.

p: Whoso sings #praise to thee at eve or #morning, and, with oblation, doth the thing thou lovest. In his own #home, even as a goId-girt courser, rescue him from distress, the bounteous giver.

p: Whoso brings #gifts to thee #Immortal, @Agni, and doth thee service with uplifted ladle. Let him not, sorely toiling, lose his #riches; let not the sinner's wickedness enclose him.

p: Whose well-wrought #worship thou acceptest, @Agni, thou @Deva a mortal's #gift, thou liberal Giver. Dear be his #offering to thee, most Youthful! an. May we strengthen him when he adores thee.

p: May he who knows distinguish sense and folly of #men, like straight and crooked backs of #horses. Lead us, O @Deva, to #wealth and noble #offspring: keep penury afar and grant us plenty.

p: This #Sage the Sages, ne’er deceived, commanded, setting him down in dwellings of the living. Henc. Mayst thou, friendly @Deva, with rapid footsteps behold the #Devas, wonderful, fair to look on.

p: Good guidance hast thou for the priest, O @Agni, who, Youngest @Deva. with outpoured #Soma serves thee. Ruler of #men, thou joyous @Deva, bring #treasure. splendid and plentiful to aid the toiler.

p: Now all that we, thy faithful servants, @Agni, have done with feet, with hands, and with our bodies, the #wise, with toil, the holy rite have guided, as those who frame a #car with manual cunning.

p: May we, seven sages first in rank, engender, from @Dawn the #Mother, #men to be ordainers. May we, #Angirases, be #sons of $Heaven, and, radiant, burst the #wealth-containing mountain.

p: As in the days of old our ancient #Fathers, speeding the #work of holy #worship, @Agni, Sought pure #light and devotion, singing praises; they cleft the ground and made red #Dawns apparent.

p: #Devas, doing holy acts, devout, resplendent, smelting like ore their #human generations. Enkindling @Agni and exalting @Indra, they came encompassing the stall of #cattle.

p: #Strong One! he marked them-and the #Devas before them-like herds of #cattle in a foodful pasture. There they moaned forth their #strong desire for mortals, to aid the True, the nearest One, the Living.

p: We have worked for thee, we have laboured nobly-bright #Dawns have shed their #light upon our #worship- Adding a #beauty to the perfect @Agni, and the @Deva's beauteous eye that shines forever.

p: @Agni, Disposer, we have sung these praises to thee the #Wise: do thou accept them gladly. Blaze up on high and ever make us richer. Give us great #wealth, O thou whose boons are many.

hymns.title: HYMN III. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: WIN, to assist you, Rudra, #Lord of #worship, Monk of both worlds, effectual Offerer, @Agni, invested with his golden colours, before the thunder strike and lay you senseless.

p: This shrine have we made ready for thy coming, as the fond dame attires her for her #husband. Performer of good #work, sit down before us, invested while these flames incline to meet thee.

p: A #hymn, O Monk, to him who hears, the gentle, to him who looks on #men, exceeding gracious, a #song of #praise sing to the @Deva.#Immortal, whom the stone, presser of the sweet #juice, worships.

p: Even as true knower of the Law, O @Agni, to this our solemn rite he thou attentive. When shall thy #songs of festival be sung thee? When is thy friendship shown within our dwelling?

p: Why this complaint to @Varuna, O @Agni? And why to $Heaven? for what is our transgression? How wilt thou speak to $Earth and bounteous @Mitra? What wilt thou say to @Aryaman and @Bhaga?

p: What, when thou blazest on the lesser altars, what to the #mighty Wind who comes to bless us, True, circumambient? what to $Earth, O @Agni, what wilt thou say to #man-destroying Rudra?

p: How to great @Pusan who promotes our welfare.to honoured Rudra what, who gives oblations? What sin of ours to the far-striding @Visnu, what, @Agni, wilt thou tell the Lofty Arrow.

p: What wilt thou tell the truthful band of #Maruts, how answer the great #Sun when thou art questioned? Before the Free, before the Swift, defend us: fulfil $Heaven's #work, all-knowing #Jatavedas.

p: I crave the #cow's true #gift arranged by #Order: though raw, she hath the sweet ripe #juice, O @Agni. Though she is black of hue with #milk she teemeth, nutritious, brightly shining, all-sustaining.

p: @Agni the Bull, the manly, hath been sprinkled with oil upon his back, by #Law eternal. He who gives vital power goes on unswerving. Prsni the Bull hath milked the pure wiiite udder.

p: By Law the #Angirases cleft the rock asunder, and sang their hymns together with the #cattle. Bringing great #bliss the #men encompassed #Morning: #light was apparent at the birth of @Agni.

p: By Law the #Immortal Devis the #Waters, with #meath-rich waves, O @Agni, and uninjuredlike a #strong courser lauded in his running, sped to #flow onward swiftly and forever.

p: Go never to the feast of one who harms us, the treacherous neighbour or unworthy kinsman. Punish us not for a false #brother's trespass. Let us not feel the #might of #friend or foeman.

p: O @Agni, keep us safe with thy protection, loving us, honoured @Deva. and ever guarding. Beat thou away, destroy severe affliction subdue e’en the demon when he waxes #mighty.

p: Through these our #songs of #praise be gracious, @Agni, moved by our meditations, O #Hero, touch our #offerings. Accept, O @Angiras, these our devotions, and let the #praise which #Devas desire address thee.

p: To thee who knowest, @Agni, thou Disposer, all these #wise secret speeches have I uttered, Sung to thee, #Sage, the charming words of wisdom, to thee, O #Singer, with. my thoughts and Praises.

hymns.title: HYMN IV. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: PUT forth like a wide-spreading net thy vigour; go like a #mighty #King with his @Attendants. Thou, following thy swift net, shootest arrows: transfix the fiends with darts that burn most fiercely.

p: Forth go in rapid flight thy whirling weapons: follow them closely, glowing in thy fury. Spread with thy tongue the winged flames, O @Agni; unfettered, cast thy firebrands all around thee.

p: Send thy spies forward, fleetest in thy motion; be, ne’er deceived, the guardian of this #people From him who, near or far, is bent on evil, and let no trouble sent from thee o’ercome us.

p: Rise up, O @Agni, spread thee out before us: burn down our foes, thou who hast sharpened arrows. Him, blazing @Agni! who hath worked us mischief, consume thou utterly like dried-up stubble.

p: Rise, @Agni, drive off those who fight against us: make manifest thine own celestial vigour. Slacken the #strong bows of the demon-driven: destroy our foemen whether kin or stranger.

p: Most Youthful @Deva, he knoweth well thy favour who gave an impulse to this high devotion. All fair days and magnificence of #riches hast thou beamed forth upon the good #man's portals.

p: Blest, @Agni, be the #man, the liberal giver, who with his lauds and regular oblation Is fain to please thee for his #life and dwelling. May all his days be bright: be this his longing.

p: I #praise thy gracious favour: sing in answer. May this my #song sing like a loved one with thee. Lords of good #steeds and #car. May we adorn thee, and day by day vouchsafe thou us dominion.

p: Here of free choice let each one serve thee richly, resplendent day by day at eve and #morning. May we honour thee, content and joyous, passing beyond the glories of the #people.

p: Whoso with good #steeds and fine #gold, O @Agni, comes nigh thee on a #car laden with #treasure., His #Friend art thou, yea, thou art his Protector whose #joy it is to entertain thee duly.

p: Through words and kinship I destroy the #mighty: this power I have from @Gotama my #father. Mark thou this speech of ours, O thou Most Youthful, #Friend of the House, exceeding #wise, invoker.

p: Knowing no slumber, speedy and propitious, alert and ever friendly, most unwearied, may thy protecting #powers, unerring @Agni, taking their places here, combined, preserve us.

p: Thy guardian rays, O @Agni, when they saw him, preserved blind Mamateya from affliction. #Lord of all #riches, he preserved the pious: the fees who fain would harm them did no mischief

p: Aided by thee with the, may we be wealthy. May we gain strength with thee to guide us onward. Fulfil the words of both, O Ever Truthful: straightway do this, thou @Deva whom power emboldens.

p: O @Agni, with this fuel will we serve thee; accept the laud we sing to thee with favour Destroy the cursing @Raksasas: preserve us, O rich in #friends, from guile and scorn and slander.

hymns.title: HYMN V. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: How shall we give with one accord oblation to @Agni, to @Vaisvanara the Bounteous? Great #light, with full high growth hath he uplifted, and, as a pillar bears the roof, sustains it.

p: Reproach not him who, @Deva.and self-reliant, vouchsafed this bounty unto me a mortal. Deathless, discerner, #wise, to me the simple, @Vaisvanara most manly, youthful @Agni.

p: Sharp-pointed, powerful, #strong, of boundless vigour, @Agni who knows the lofty #hymn, kept secret As the lost #MilchCow's track, the doubly #Mighty.he hath declared to me this hidden knowledge.

p: May he with sharpened teeth, the Bounteous Giver, @Agni, consume with flame most fiercely glowing. Those who regard not @Varuna's commandments and the dear stedfast laws of sapient @Mitra.

p: Like youthful women without brothers, straying, like #dames who hate their lords, of evil conduct, they who are full of sin, untrue, unfaithful, they have engendered this abysmal station.

p: To me, weak, innocent luminous @Agni, hast boldly given as ’twere a heavy burthen, This Prstha #hymn, profound and #strong and #mighty, of seven #elements, and with offered dainties.

p: May our #song that purifies, through wisdom reach in a moment him the Universal, Established on the height, on $Earth's best station, above the beauteous grassy skin of Prsni.

p: Of this my speech what shall I utter further? They indicate the #milk stored up in secret When they have thrown as ’twere the cows' stalls open. The #Bird protects earths’ best and well-loved station.

p: This is the Great Ones’ #mighty apparition which from of old the radiant #Cow hath followed. This, shining brightly in the place of #Order, swift, hasting on in secret, she discovered.

p: He then who shone together with his #Parents remembered Prsni's fair and secret #treasure., Which, in the #Mother #Cow's most lofty station, the Bull's tongue, of the flame bent forward, tasted.

p: With #reverence I declare the Law, O @Agni; what is, comes by thine #order, #Jatavedas. Of this, whate’er it be, thou art the Sovran, yea, all the #wealth that is in $Earth or $Heaven.

p: What is our #wealth therefrom, and what our #treasure.? Tell us O #Jatavedas, for thou knowest, what is our best course in this secret passage: we, unreproached, have reached a place far distant.

p: What is the limit, what the rules, the guerdon? Like fleet-foot coursers speed we to the contest. When will the Devis, the #Immortal's #Spouses, the #Dawns, spread over us the @SunDeva's #splendour?

p: Unsatisfied, with speech devoid of vigour, scanty and frivolous and inconclusive, Wherefore do they address thee here, O @Agni? Let these who have no weapons suffer sorrow.

p: The majesty of him the Good, the #Mighty, aflame, hath shone for #glory in the dwelling. He, clothed in #light, hath shone most fair to look on, wealthy in boons, as a #home shines with #riches.

hymns.title: HYMN VI. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: PRIEST of our rite, stand up erect, O @Agni, in the #Devas’ service best of offerers, for over evei y thought thou art the Ruler: thou furtherest e’en the wisdom of the pious.

p: He was set down mid #men as Monk unerring, @Agni, #wise, welcome in our holy synods. Like @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu he hath lifted up his #splendour, and like a builder raised his smoke to $Heaven.

p: The glowing ladle, filled with oil, is lifted; choosing #Devas’ service to the right he circles. Eager he rises like the new-wrought pillar which, firmly set and fixed, anoints the victims.

p: When sacred #grass is strewn and @Agni kindled, the Adhvaryu rises to, his task rejoicing. @Agni the Monk, like one who tends the #cattle, goes three times round, as from of old he wills it.

p: @Agni himself, the Monk, with measured motion, goes round, with sweet speech, cheerful, true to #Order. His fulgent flames run forth like vigorous #horses; all creatures are affrighted when he blazes.

p: Beautiful and auspicious is thine aspect, O lovely @Agni, terrible when spreading. Thy splendours are not covered by the darkness: detraction leaves no stain upon thy body.

p: Naught hindered his production, Bounteous Giver: his #Mother and his Sire were free to send him. Then as #Friend benevolent, refulgent, @Agni shone forth in #human habitations.

p: He, @Agni, whom the twice-five sisters, dwelling together, in the homes of #men engendered, Bright like a spear's tooth, wakened in the #morning, with powerful mouth and like an axe well-sharpened.

p: These thy Bay Coursers, @Agni, dropping fatness, ruddy vigorous, speeding straightly forward, and red #steeds, wonderful, of #mighty muscle, are to this service of the #Devas invited:

p: These brightly-shining games of thine, O @Agni, that move forever restless, all-subduinglike falcons hasting eagerly to the quarry, roar loudly like the army of the #Maruts.

p: To thee, O flaming @Deva, hath prayer been offered. Let the #Sage laud thee: give to him who worships. #Men have established @Agni as Invoker, fain to adore the #glory of the living.

hymns.title: HYMN VII. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: HERE by ordainers was this @Deva appointed first Invoker, best at #worship, to be praised at rites: Whom Apnavana, and the #Bhrgus caused to #shine bright-coloured in the wood, spreading from #home to #home.

p: When shall thy #glory as a @Deva, @Agni, be suddenly shown forth. For mortal #men have held thee fast, #adorable in all their homes,

p: Seeing thee faithful to the Law, most sapient, like the starry $Heaven, Illumining with cheerful ray each solemn rite in every house.

p: @Vivasvan's envoy living #men have taken as their ensign, swift, the ruler over all #mankind, moving like Bhrgu in each #home.

p: Him the intelligent have they placed duly as Invoking Monk, Welcome, with sanctifying flame, best #worshipper, with sevenfold #might;

p: In his Eternal Mothers, in the wood, concealed and unapproached, Kept secret though his flames are bright seeking on all sides, quickly found.

p: That as #food spreads forth in this earthly udder, @Deva. May rejoice them in the #home of #Order, Great @Agni, served with #reverence and oblation, flies ever to  'the #offering, the Faithful.

p: #Bird of each rite, skilled in an envoy's duties, knowing both worlds and that which lies between them, Thou goest from of old a willing Herald, knowing full well $Heaven's innermost recesses.

p: Bright @Deva, thy path is black: #light is before thee: thy moving #splendour is the #chief of wonders. When she, yet unimpregnate, hath conceived thee, even when newly #born thou art an envoy.

p: Yet newly #born, his vigour is apparent when the wind blows upon his fiery #splendour, His sharpened tongue he layeth on the brushwood, and with his teeth e’en solid #food consumeth.

p: When he hath borne off #food with swift flame swiftly, #strong @Agni makes himself a speedy envoy, Follows the rustling of the wind, consuming, and courser-like, speeds, drives the swift #horse onward.

hymns.title: HYMN VIII. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: YOUR envoy who possesses all, #Immortal, bearer of your #gifts, best #worshipper, I woo with #song.

p: He, #Mighty, knows the #gift of #wealth, he knows the deep recess of $Heaven: He shall bring hitherward the #Devas.

p: He knows, a @Deva.himself, to guide #Devas to the righteous in his #home: He gives e’en #treasure.s that we love.

p: He is the Herald: well-informed, he doth his errand to and fro, knowing the deep recess of $Heaven.

p: May we be they who gratify @Agni with #offerings #gifts, who cherish and enkindle him.

p: Illustrious for #wealth are they, and #hero deeds, victorious, who have served @Agni reverently.

p: So unto us, day after day. May #riches craved by many come, and power and #might spring up for us.

p: That holy #Singer in his strength shoots forth his arrows swifter than The swift shafts of the tribes of #men.

hymns.title: HYMN IX. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: @Agni, show favour: great art thou who to this pious #man art come, to seat thee on the sacred #grass.

p: May he the #Immortal. Helper, bard to be deceived among #mankind, become the messenger of all.

p: Around the altar is he led, welcome #Chief Monk at solemn rites, or as the @Potar sits him down.

p: @Agni in fire at #offering, and in the house as #Lord thereof, and as a Brahman takes his seat.

p: Thou comest as the guide of folk who celebrate a #offering, and to oblations brought by #men.

p: Thou servest as his messenger whose #offering thou lovest well, to bear the mortal's #gifts to $Heaven.

p: Accept our solemn rite; be pleased, @Angiras, with  'our #offering: Give ear and listen to our #call.

p: May thine inviolable #car, wherewith thou guardest those who give, Come near to us from every side.

hymns.title: HYMN X. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: This day with praises, @Agni, we bring thee that which thou lovest. Right judgment, like a #horse, with our devotions.

p: For thou hast ever been the #Car-driver, @Agni, of noble Strength, lofty #offering, and rightful judgment.

p: Through these our praises come thou to meet us, bright as the sunlight, O @Agni, well disposed, with all thine aspects.

p: No. May we serve thee singing these lauds this day to thee, @Agni. Loud as the #voice of $Heaven thy blasts are roaring.

p: Just at this time of the day and the night thy look is the sweetest: It shineth near us even as #gold for #glory.

p: Spotless thy body, brilliant as #gold, like clarified butter: This gleams like #gold on thee, O Self. dependent.

p: All hate and mischief, yea, if committed, @Agni, thou turnest, Holy One, from the #man who rightly worships.

p: @Agni, with you #Devas, prosperous be our friendships and kinships. Be this our bond here by this place, thine altar.

hymns.title: HYMN XI. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: THY blessed majesty, victorious @Agni, shines brightly in the neighbourhood of @Surya. Splendid to see, it shows even at nighttime, and #food is fair to look on in thy #beauty.

p: @Agni, disclose his thought for him who singeth, the well, #Strong @Deva. while thou art praised with fervour. Vouchsafe to us that powerful #hymn, O #Mighty, which, Radiant One! with all the #Devas thou lovest.

p: From thee, O @Agni, springs poetic wisdom, from thee come thoughts and hymns of #praise that prosper; From thee flows #wealth, with #heroes to adorn it, to the true-hearted #man who gives oblation.

p: From thee the #hero springs who wins the booty, bringer of #help, #mighty, of real courage. From thee comes #wealth, sent by the #Devas, #bliss-giving; @Agni, from thee the fleet impetuous charger.

p: #Immortal @Agni, thee whose #voice is pleasant, as first in rank, as @Deva, religious mortals Invite with hymns; thee who removest hatred, #Friend of the #Home, the household's #Lord, unerring.

p: Far from us thou removest want and sorrow, far from us all ill-will when thou protectest. #Son of Strength, @Agni, blest is he at evening, whom thou as @Deva.attendest for his welfare.

hymns.title: HYMN XII. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: WHOSO enkindles thee, with lifted ladle, and thrice this day #offers thee #food, O @Agni, may he excel, triumphant through thy splendours, #wise through thy mental power, O #Jatavedas.

p: Whoso with toil and trouble brings thee fuel, serving the majesty of #mighty @Agni. He, kindling thee at evening and at #morning, prospers, and comes to #wealth, and subdues his foemen.

p: @Agni is #Master of sublime dominion, @Agni is #Lord of strength and lofty #riches. Straightway the self-reliant @Deva, most Youthful, gives #treasure.s to the mortal who adores him.

p: Most Youthful @Deva, whatever sin, through folly, we here, as #human beings, have committed, in sight of @Aditi make thou us sinless remit, entirely, @Agni, our offences.

p: Even in the presence of great sin, O @Agni, free us from prison of the #Devas or mortals. Neve. May we who are thy #friends be injured: grant health and strength unto our seed and #offspring.

p: Even as ye here, #Devas #Excellent and Holy, have loosed the #cow that by the foot was tethered, So also set us free from this affliction long let our #life, O @Agni, be extended.

hymns.title: HYMN XIII. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: @Agni hath looked, benevolently-minded, on the #wealth-giving spring of radiant Mornings. Come, @Asvins, to the dwelling of the pious: @Surya the @Indu is rising with his #splendour.

p: @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, @Deva, hath spread on high his lustre, waving his flag like a #spoil-seeking #hero. Their stablished way go @Varuna and @Mitra, what time they make the #Sun #ascend the $Heaven.

p: Him whom they made to drive away the darkness, Lords of sure mansions, constant to their objecthim who beholds the universe, the @SunDeva, seven #strong and youthful Coursers carry onward.

p: Spreading thy web with mightiest #Steeds thou comest, rending apart, thou @Deva, the black-hued mantle. The rays of @Surya tremulously shining sink, like a hide, the darkness in the #waters.

p: How is it that, unbound and not supported, he falleth not although directed downward? By what self power moves he? Who hath seen it? He guards the vault of $Heaven, a close-set pillar.

hymns.title: HYMN XIV. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: THE @Deva.hath looked, even @Agni #Jatavedas, to meet the #Dawns refulgent in their glories. Come on your chariot, ye who travel widely, come to this #offering of ours, @Nasatyas.

p: Producing #light for all the world of creatures, @Deva.@Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu hath raised aloft his banner. Making his presence known by sunbeams, @Surya hath filled the $Firmament and $Earth and $Heaven.

p: Red @Dawn is come, riding with brightness onward, distinguished by her beams, gay-hued and #mighty. @Dawn on her nobly-harnessed #car, the Devi, awaking #men to happiness, approacheth.

p: May those most powerful #steeds and chariot bring you, O @Asvins, hither at the break of #morning. Here for your draught of #meath are #Soma juices: at this  'our #offering rejoice, ye #Mighty.

p: How is it that, unbound and unsupported, he falleth not although directed downward? By what self-power moves he? Who hath seen it? He guards the vault of $Heaven, a close-set pillar?

hymns.title: HYMN XV. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: @Agni the Herald, like a #horse, is led forth at our solemn rite, @Deva.among #Devas #adorable.

p: Three times unto our solemn rite comes @Agni like a charioteer, bearing the #offerings to the #Devas.

p: Round the oblations hath he paced, @Agni the #Wise, the #Lord of Strength, giving the offerer precious boons.

p: He who is kindled eastward for Srnjaya, Devavata's #son, Resplendent, tamer of the foe.

p: So #mighty be the @Agni whom the mortal #hero shall command, with sharpened teeth and bountiful.

p: Day after day they dress him, as they clean a #horse who wins the prize. Dress the red Scion of the $Sky.

p: When Sahadeva's princely #son with two #bay #horses thought of me, Summoned by him I drew not back.

p: And truly those two noble bays I straightway took when offered me, From Sahadeva's princely #son.

p: Long, O ye @Asvins. May he live, your care, ye #Devas, the princely #son. Of Sahadeva, Somaka.

p: Cause him the youthful prince, the #son of Sahadeva, to enjoy Long #life, O @Asvins, O ye #Devas.

hymns.title: HYMN XVI. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: IMPETUOUS, true, let @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu come hither, and let his #Tawny Coursers speed to reach us. For him have we pressed #juice exceeding potent: here, praised with #song, let him effect his visit.

p: Unyoke, as at thy #journey's end, O #Hero, to gladden thee today at this libation. Like @Usana, the #Sage a laud shall utter, a #hymn to thee, the #Lord Divine, who markest.

p: When the Bull, quaffing, praises our libation, as a #sage paying holy rites in secret, Seven singers here from $Heaven hath he begotten, who e’en by day have wrought their works while singing.

p: When $Heaven's fair #light by hymns was made apparent (they made great #splendour #shine at break of #morning). He with his assist, best of #Heroes, scattered the blinding darkness so that #men saw clearly.

p: @Indra, Impetuous One, hath waxed immensely: he with his vastness hath filled $Earth and $Heaven. E’en beyond this his majesty extendeth who hath exceeded all the worlds in greatness.

p: @Sakra who knoweth well all #human actions hath with his eager #Friends let loose the #waters. They with their #songs cleft e’en the mountain open and willingly disclosed the stall of #cattle.

p: He smote away the floods' obstructer, @Vrtra; $Earth, conscious, lent her aid to speed thy thunder. Thou sentest forth the #waters of the $Ocean, as #Lord through power and #might, O daring #Hero.

p: When, Much-invoked! the #water's rock thou cleftest, @Sarama showed herself and went before thee. Hymned by #Angirases, bursting the #cow-stalls, much strength thou foundest for us as our #leader.

p: Come, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, #Friend of #Man, to aid the #singer imploring thee in battle for the sunlight. Speed him with #help in his inspired invokings: down sink the sorcerer, the prayerless #Dasyu.

p: Come to our #home resolved to subdue the #Dasyu: @Kutsa longed eagerly to win thy friendship. Alike in #form ye both sate in his dwelling the faithful Lady was in doubt between you.

p: Thou comest, fain to assist him, with @Kutsa.a goad that #masters both the Wind-@Deva's #horses, that, holding the brown #steeds like #spoil for capture, the sag. May on the final day be present.

p: For @Kutsa, with thy thousand, thou at day-break didst hurl down greedy @Susna, foe of harvest. Quickly with @Kutsa's #friend destroy the #Dasyus, and roll the chariot-wheel of @Surya near us.

p: Thou to the #son of Vidathin, @Rjisvan, gavest up #mighty Mrgaya and Pipru. Thou smotest down the swarthy fifty thousand, and rentest forts as age consumes a garment.

p: What time thou settest near the #Sun thy body, thy #form, #Immortal One, is seen expanding: Thou a wild elephant with #might invested. like a dread lion as thou wieldest weapons.

p: Wishes for #wealth have gone to @Indra, longing for him in war for #light and at libation, Eager for #glory, labouring with praisesongs: he is like #home, like sweet and fair nutrition.

p: #Call we for you that @Indra, prompt to listen, him who hath done so much for #men's advantage. Who, #Lord of envied bounty, to a #singer like me brings quickly booty worth the capture.

p: When the sharp-pointed arrow, O thou #Hero, flieth mid any conflict of the #people, when, Faithful One, the dread encounter cometh, then be thou the Protector of our body.

p: Further the holy thoughts of Vamadeva be thou a guileless #Friend in fight for booty. We come to thee whose providence protects us: wide be thy sway forever for thy #singer.

p: O @Indra, with these #men who love thee truly, free givers, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, in every battle, may we rejoice through many autumns, quelling our foes, as days subdue the nights with #splendour.

p: Now, as the #Bhrgus wrought a #car, for @Indra the #Strong, the #Mighty, we our #meditation have fashioned, that h. May, ne’er withdraw from us his friendship, but be our bodies' guard and #strong defender.

p: Now, @Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell. high like #rivers for the #singer. For thee a new #hymn, #Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, #car-borne, through #song be victors ever.

hymns.title: HYMN XVII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: GREAT art thou, @Indra; yea, the $Earth, with gladness, and $Heaven confess to thee thine high dominion. Thou in thy vigour having slaughtered @Vrtra didst free the floods arrested by the Dragon.

p: $Heaven trembled at the birth of thine effulgence; $Earth trembled at the fear of thy displeasure. The stedfast #mountains shook in agitation . the #waters flowed, and desert spots were flooded.

p: Hurling his bolt with #might he cleft the mountain, while, putting forth his strength, he showed his vigour. He slaughtered @Vrtra with his bolt, exulting, and, their #lord slain, forth flowed the #waters swiftly.

p: Thy #Father #Dyaus esteemed himself a #hero: most noble was the #work of @Indra's Maker, His who begat the #strong bolt's #Lord who roareth, immovable like $Earth from her foundation.

p: He who alone o’erthrows the world of creatures, @Indra the peoples' #King, invoked of many- Verily all rejoice in him, extolling the boons which @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar hath sent them.

p: All #Soma juices are his own forever, most gladdening draughts are ever his, the #Mighty, Thou ever wast the #Treasure-#Lord of #treasure.s: @Indra, thou lettest all folk share thy bounty.

p: Moreover, when thou first wast #born, O @Indra, thou struckest terror into all the #people. Thou, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, rentest with thy bolt the Dragon who lay against the waterfloods of $Heaven.

p: The ever-subduing, bold and furious @Indra, the bright bolt's #Lord, infinite, #strong and #mighty, who slayeth @Vrtra and acquireth booty, giver of blessings, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu the bounteous:

p: Alone renowned as @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu in battles, he frighteneth away assembled #armies. He bringeth us the booty that he winnet. May we, well-loved, continue in his friendship.

p: Renowned is he when conquering and when subduing: 'fis he who winneth #cattle in the combat. When @Indra hardeneth his indignation all that is fixed and all that moveth fear him.

p: @Indra hath won all kine, all #gold, all #horses.@Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, he who breaketh forts in pieces; Most manly with these #men of his who #help him, dealing out #wealth and gathering the #treasure..

p: What is the care of @Indra for his #Mother, what cares he for the #Father who begat him? His care is that which speeds his #might in conflicts, like wind borne onward by the clouds that thunder.

p: @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu makes the settled #man unsettled: he scatters dust that he hath swept together, Breaking in pieces like $Heaven armed with lightning: @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu shall enrich the #man who lauds h;m.

p: He urged the chariot-wheel of @Surya forward: @Etasa, speeding on his way, he rested. Him the black undulating cloud bedeweth, in this $$Mid-#Air's depth, at the base of darkness,

p: As in the night the sacrificing priest.

p: Eager for booty, craving strength and #horses, we-singers stir @Indra, the #strong, for friendship, who gives the wives we seek, whose assist fails not, to hasten, like a pitcher to the fountain.

p: Be thou our guardian, show thyself our kinsman, watching and #blessing those who pour the #Soma; As #Friend, as Sire, most fatherly of #fathers giving the suppliant vital strength and freedom.

p: Be helping #Friend of those who seek thy friendship . give #life, when lauded, @Indra, to the #singer. For, @Indra, we the monks have paid thee #worship, exalting thee with these  'our #offerings.

p: Alone, when @Indra @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu is lauded, he slayeth many ne’er-resisted #Vrtras. Him in whose keeping is the well-loved #singer never do #Devas or mortals stay or hinder.

p: E’en so let @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, the loud-voiced @Indra, give us true blessings, foeless, #men's upholder. #King of all creatures, give us #glory amply, exalted #glory due to him who lauds thee.

p: Now, @Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high like #rivers for the #singer. For thee a new #hymn, #Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, #car-borne, through #song be victors ever.

hymns.title: HYMN XVIII. Indra and Others.
hymns.text:
p: THIS is the ancient and accepted pathway by which all #Devas have come into existence. Hereby could one be #born though waxen #mighty. Let him not, otherwise, destroy his #Mother.

p: Not this way go I forth: hard is the passage. Forth from the side obliquely will I issue. Much that is yet undone must I accomplish; one must I combat and the other question.

p: He bent his eye upon the dying #Mother: My word I now withdraw. That way I follow. In @Tvastar's dwelling India drank the #Soma, a hundredworth of #juice pressed from the mortar.

p: What strange act shall he do, he whom his #Mother bore for a thousand months and many autumns? No peer hath he among those #born already, nor among those who shall be #born hereafter.

p: Deeming him a reproach, his #mother hid him, @Indra, endowed with all heroic valour. Then up he sprang himself, assumed his vesture, and filled, as soon as #born, the $Earth and $Heaven.

p: With lively motion onward #flow these #waters, the #Holy Ones, shouting, as ’twere, together. Ask them to. tell thee what the floods are saying, what girdling rock the #waters burst asunder.

p: Are they addressing him with words of welcome? Will the floods take on them the shame of @Indra? With his great thunderbolt my #Son hath slaughtered @Vrtra, and set these #rivers free to wander.

p: I cast thee from me, mine.thy youthful #mother: thee, mine own #offspring, Kusava hath swallowed. To him, mine infant, were the #waters gracious. @Indra, my #Son, rose up in conquering vigour.

p: Thou art mine own, O @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, whom Vyamsa struck to the ground and smote thy jaws in pieces. But, smitten through, the mastery thou wonnest, and with thy bolt the Dasa's head thou crushedst.

p: The Heifer hath brought forth the #Strong, the #Mighty, the unconquerable Bull, the furious @Indra. The #Mother left her unlicked Calf to wander, seeking himself, the path that he would follow.

p: Then to her #mighty #Child the #Mother turned her, saying, My #son, these #Deities forsake thee. Then @Indra said, about to slaughter @Vrtra, O my #friend @Vrtra, stride full boldly forward.

p: Who was he then who made thy #Mother widow? Who sought to stay thee lying still or moving? What @Deva, when by the foot thy Sire thou tookest and slewest, was at hand to give thee comfort?

p: In deep distress I cooked a dog's intestines. Among the #Devas I found not one to comfort. My consort I beheld in degradation. The Falcon then brought me the pleasant #Soma.

hymns.title: HYMN XIX. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: THEE, verily, O Thunder-wielding @Indra, all the #Devas here, the Helpers swift to listen, and both the worlds elected, thee the #Mighty, High, waxen #strong, alone to slaughter @Vrtra.

p: The #Devas, as worn witheld, relaxed their efforts: thou, @Indra, #born of truth, wast Sovran Ruler. Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the #waters, and duggest out their all-supporting channels.

p: The insatiate one, extended, hard to waken, who slumbered in perpetual sleep, O @Indra. The Dragon stretched against the seven prone #rivers, where no joint was, thou rentest with thy thunder.

p: @Indra with #might shook $Earth and her foundation as the wind stirs the #water with its fury. Striving, with strength he burst the firm asunder, and tore away the summits of the #mountains.

p: They ran to thee as mothers to their #offspring: the clouds, like #chariots, hastened forth together. Thou didst refresh the #streams and force the billows: thou, @Indra, settest free obstructed #rivers.

p: Thou for the sake of @Vayya and @Turviti didst stay the great #stream, flowing, all-sustaining: Yea, at their prayer didst check the rushing #river and make the floods easy to cross, O @Indra.

p: He let the young Maids skilled in Law, unwedded, like fountains, bubbling, #flow forth streaming onward. He inundated thirsty plains and deserts, and milked the dry Cows of the #mighty #master.

p: Through many a morn and many a lovely autumn, having slain @Vrtra, he set free the #rivers. @Indra hath set at liberty to wander on $Earth the #streams encompassed pressed together.

p: #Lord of Bay #Steeds, thou broughtest from the ant-hill the unwedded damsel's #son whom ants were eating. The blind saw clearly, as he grasped the serpent, rose, brake the jar: his joints again united.

p: To the #wise #man, O #Sage and Sovran Ruler, the #man who knoweth all thine ancient exploits. Hath told these deeds of #might as thou hast wrought them, great acts, spontaneous, and to #man's advantage.

p: Now, @Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let #powers swell high, like #rivers, for the #singer. For thee a new #hymn, #Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, #car-borne, through #song be victors ever.

hymns.title: HYMN XX. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: FROM near or far awa. May #mighty @Indra giver of assist, come for our protection #Lord of #men, armed with thunder, with the Strongest, subduing his foes in conflict, in the battles.

p: May @Indra come to us with #Tawny Coursers, inclined to us, to favour and enrich us. May @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, loud-voiced and wielding thunder, stand by us at this #offering, in combat.

p: Thou, honouring this  'our #offering, O @Indra, shalt give us strength and fill us full of courage. To win the booty, Thunder-armed! like hunter. May we with thee subdue in fight our foemen.

p: Loving us well, benevolent, close beside us, drink, @Deva.ike @Indra, of the well-pressed #Soma. Drink of the #meath we offer, and #delight thee with #food that cometh from the mountain ridges.

p: Him who is sung aloud by recent sages, like a ripe-fruited tree, a scythe-armed victor. I, like a bridegroom thinking of his consort, #call hither @Indra, him invoked of many;

p: Him who in native strength is like a mountain, the lofty @Indra #born or old for conquest, Terrific wielder of the ancient thunder. filled full with #splendour as a jar with #water.

p: Whom from of old there is not one to hinder, none to curtail the #riches of his bounty. Pouring forth freely, O thou #Strong and #Mighty, vouchsafe us #riches, @Deva.invoked of many!

p: Of #wealth and homes of #men thou art the ruler, and opener of the stable of the #cattle. Helper of #men, winner of #spoil in combats, thou leadest to an ample heap of #riches.

p: By what great #might is he renowned as strongest, wherewith the Lofty One stirs up wild battles? Best soother of the #worshipper's great sorrow, he gives possessions to the #man who lauds him.

p: Slay us not; bring, bestow onus the ample #gift which thou hast to give to him who #offers. At this new #gift, with this laud sung before thee, extolling thee, we, @Indra, will declare it.

p: Now, @Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high, like #rivers, for the #singer. A new #hymn, #Lord of Bays! for thee is fashioned. May we, #car-#born, through #song be victors ever.

hymns.title: HYMN XXI. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: MAY @Indra come to us for our protection; here be the #Hero, praised, our feast-companion. May he whose #powers are many, waxen #mighty, cherish, like #Dyaus, his own supreme dominion.

p: Here magnify his great heroic exploits, most #glorious One, enriching #men with bounties, whose will is like a Sovran in assembly, who rules the #people, Conqueror, all-surpassing.

p: Hither let @Indra come from $Earth or $Heaven, hither with speech from $Firmament or $Ocean; With #Maruts, from the realm of #light to aid us, or from a distance, from the seat of #Order.

p: That @Indra will we laud in our assemblies, him who is #Lord of great and lasting #riches, Victor with @Vayu where the herds are gathered, who leads with boldness on to higher fortune.

p: May the Monk, #Lord of many blessings, striving.who fixing #reverence on #reverence, giving Vent to his #voice, inciteth #men to #worship—with lauds bring @Indra hither to our dwellings.

p: When sitting pondering in deep devotion in Ausija's abode they ply the press-stone, may he whose wrath is fierce, the #mighty bearer, come as the house-#lord's priest within our chambers.

p: Surely the power of Bharvara the #mighty forever helpeth to support the #singer; That which in Ausija's abode lies hidden, to come forth for #delight and for devotion.

p: When he unbars the spaces of the #mountains, and quickens with his floods the #water-torrents. He finds in lair the buffalo and wild-ox when the #wise lead him on to vigorous exploit.

p: Auspicious are thy hands, thine arms well-fashioned which proffer bounty, @Indra, to thy praiser. What sloth is this? Why dost thou not rejoice thee? Why dost thou not #delight thyself with giving?

p: So @Indra is the truthful #Lord of #treasure.. Freedom he gave to #man by subduing @Vrtra. Much-lauded! #help us with thy power to #riches. May I be sharer of thy @Deva.ike favour.

p: Now, @Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high, like #rivers, for the #singer. For thee a new #hymn, #Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, care-borne, through #song be victors ever.

hymns.title: HYMN XXII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: THAT #gift of ours which @Indra loves and welcomes, even that he makes for us, the Great and #Strong One. He who comes wielding in his #might the thunder, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, gives prayer, #praise, and laud, and #Soma.

p: Bull, hurler of the four-edged #rain-producer with both his arms, #strong, #mighty, most heroic; Wearing as wool Parusni for adornment, whose joints for sake of friendship he hath covered.

p: @Deva who of all the #Devas was #born divinest, endowed with ample strength and #mighty #powers, and bearing in his arms the yearning thunder, with violent rush caused $Heaven and $Earth to tremble.

p: Before the High @Deva, at his birth, $Heaven trembled, $Earth, many floods and all the precipices. The #Strong One bringeth nigh the Bull's two #Parents: loud sing the winds, like #men, in #air's mid-region.

p: These are thy great deeds, @Indra, thine, the #Mighty, deeds to be told aloud at all #libations, that thou, O #Hero, bold and boldly daring, didst with thy bolt, by strength, destroy the Dragon.

p: True are all these thy deeds, O Most Heroic. The Milch-kine issued from the streaming udder. In fear of thee, O thou of manly #spirit, the #rivers swiftly set themselves in motion.

p: With #joy, O @Indra, #Lord of #Tawny Coursers, the Sisters then, these Devis, extolled thee, when thou didst give the prisoned ones their freedom to wander at their will in long succession.

p: Pressed is the gladdening stalk as ’twere a #river: so let the rite, the toiler's power, attract thee To us-ward, of the Bright One, as the courser strains his. exceedingly #strong leather bridle.

p: Ever by us perform thy most heroic, thine highest, best victorious deeds, O Victor. For us make #Vrtras easy to be conquered: destroy the weapon of our mortal foeman.

p: Graciously listen to our #meditation, O @Indra, and strength of varied sort bestow thou on us. Send to us all intelligence arid wisdom O @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, be he who gives us #cattle.

p: Now, @Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let #wealth swell high like #rivers to the #singer. For thee a new #hymn, #Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, #car-borne, through #song be victors ever.

hymns.title: HYMN XXIII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: How, what priest's #offering hath he made #mighty, rejoicing in the #Soma and its fountain? Delighting in #juice, eagerly drinking, the Lofty One hath waxed for splendid #riches.

p: What #hero hath been made his feast-companion? Who hath been partner in his loving-kindness? What know we of his wondrous acts? How often comes he to aid and speed the pious toiler?

p: How heareth @Indra offered invocation? How, hearing, marketh he the invoker's wishes? What are his ancient acts of bounty? Wherefore #call they him One who filleth full the #singer?

p: How doth the #Sage who laboureth, ever longing, win for himself the #wealth which he possesseth? May he, the @Deva, mark well my truthful praises, having received the homage which he loveth.

p: How, and what bond of friendship with a mortal hath the @Deva.chosen as this morn is breaking? How, and what love hath he for those who love him, who have entwined in him their firm affection?

p: Is then thy friendship with thy #friends most #mighty? Thy #brotherhood with us.whe. May we tell it? The #streams of #milk move, as most wondrous sunlight, the #beauty of the Lovely One for #glory.

p: About to stay the @Indra-less destructive #spirit he sharpens his keen arms to strike her. Whereby the #Strong, although our debts’ exactor, drives in the distant mornings that we know not.

p: Eternal Law hath varied #food that strengthens; thought of eternal Law, removes transgressions. The #praise-#hymn of eternal Law, arousing, glowing, hath oped the deaf ears of the living.

p: Firm-seated are eternal Law's foundations in its fair #form are many splendid beauties. By holy Law long lasting #food they bring us; by holy Law have cows come to our #worship.

p: Fixing eternal Law he, too, upholds it swift moves the #might of Law and wins the booty. To Law belong the vast deep $Earth and $Heaven: Milch-kine supreme, to Law their #milk they render.

p: Now, @Indra! lauded.glorified with praises, let power swell high like #rivers to the #singer. For thee a new #hymn, #Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, #car-borne, through #song be victors ever.

hymns.title: HYMN XXIV. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: WHAT worthy #praise will bring before us @Indra, the #Son of Strength, that h. May grant us #riches; For he the #Hero, gives the #singer #treasure.s: he is the #Lord who sends us #gifts, ye #people.

p: To be invoked and hymned in fight with @Vrtra, that well-praised @Indra gives us real bounties. That @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu brings comfort in the foray to the religious #man who pours #libations.

p: Him, verily, the #men invoke in combat; risking their lives they make him their protector, when #heroes, foe to foe, give up their bodies, fighting, each side, for children and their #offspring.

p: #Strong @Deva. the folk at need put forth their vigour, striving together in the whirl of battle. When #warrior bands encounter one another some in the grapple quit themselves like @Indra.

p: Hence many a one worships the #might of @Indra: hence let the brew succeed the meal-oblation. Hence let the #Soma banish those who pour not: even hence I #joy to pay the #Strong One #worship.

p: @Indra gives comfort to the #man who truly presses, for him who longs for it, the #Soma, Not disaffected, with devoted #spirit this #man he takes to be his #friend in battles.

p: He who this day for @Indra presses #Soma, prepares the brew and fries the grains of barley— Loving the hymns of that devoted servant, to hi. May @Indra give heroic vigour.

p: When the impetuous #chief hath sought the conflict, and the #lord looked upon the long-drawn battle, the @Matron calls to the #Strong @Deva whom pressers of #Soma have encouraged in the dwelling.

p: He bid a small price for a thing of value: I was content, returning, still unpurchased. He heightened not his insufficient offer. Simple and clever, both #milk out the udder.

p: Who for ten milch-kine purchaseth from me this @Indra who is mine? When he hath slain the #Vrtras let the buyer give him back to me.

p: Now, @Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let #wealth swell high like #rivers for the #singer. For thee a new #hymn, #Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, #car-borne, through #song be victors ever.

hymns.title: HYMN XXV. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: WHAT #friend of #man, @Deva.loving, hath delighted, yearning therefor, this day in @Indra's friendship? Who with enkindled flame and flowing #Soma laudeth him for his great protecting favour?

p: Who hath with prayer bowed to the #Soma-lover? What pious #man endues the beams of #morning? Who seeks bond, friendship, #brotherhood with @Indra? Who hath recourse unto the #Sage for assist?

p: Who claims to-day the #Deities' protection, asks @Aditi for #light, or the @Adityas? Of whose pressed stalk of #Soma drink the @Asvins, @Indra, and @Agni, well-inclined in #spirit?

p: To him shall @Agni @Bharata give shelter: long shall he look upon the #Sun up-rising, who sayeth, Let us press the #juice for @Indra, #man's #Friend, the #Hero manliest of #heroes.

p: Him neither few #men overcome, nor many to him shall @Aditi give spacious shelter. Dear is the pious, the devout, to @Indra dear is the zealous, dear the #Soma-bringer.

p: This #Hero curbs the #mighty for the zealous: the presser's brew @Indra possesses solely: No #brother, kin, or #friend to him who pours not, destroyer of the dumb who would resist him.

p: Not with the wealthy churl who pours no #Soma doth @Indra, #Soma-drinker, bind alliance. He draws away his #wealth and subdues him naked, own #Friend to him who #offers, for oblation.

p: Highest and lowest, #men who stand between diem, going, returning, dwelling in contentment, Those who show forth their strength when urged to battle-these are the #men who #call for aid on @Indra.

hymns.title: HYMN XXVI. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: I WAS aforetime Manu, I was @Surya: I am the #sage Kaksivan, holy #singer. @Kutsa the #son of Arjuni I #master. I am the sapient @Usana behold me.

p: I have bestowed the $Earth upon the Arya, and #rain upon the #man who brings oblation. I guided forth the loudly-roaring #waters, and the #Devas moved according to my pleasure.

p: In the wild #joy of #Soma I demolished Sambara's forts, ninety-and-nine, together; And, utterly, the hundredth habitation, when helping Divodasa @Atithigva.

p: Before all birds be ranked this #Bird, O #Maruts; supreme of falcons be this fleet-winged Falcon, because, #strong- pinioned, with no #car to bear him, he brought to Manu the @Deva.oved oblation.

p: When the #Bird brought it, hence in rapid motion sent on the wide path fleet as thought he hurried. Swift he returned with sweetness of the #Soma, and hence the Falcon hath acquired his #glory.

p: Bearing the stalk, the Falcon speeding onward, #Bird bringing from afar the draught that gladdens, #Friend of the #Devas, brought, grasping fast, the #Soma which be bad taken from yon loftiest $Heaven.

p: The Falcon took and brought the #Soma, bearing thousand #libations with him, yea, ten thousand. The Bold One left Malignities behind him, #wise, in wild #joy of #Soma, left the foolish.

hymns.title: HYMN XXVII. The Falcon.
hymns.text:
p: I, as I lay within the womb, considered all generations of these #Devas in #order. A hundred iron fortresses confined me but forth I flew with rapid speed a Falcon.

p: Not at his own free pleasure did he bear me: he conquered with his strength and manly courage. Straightway the Bold One left the fiends behind him and passed the winds as he grew yet more #mighty.

p: When with loud cry from $Heaven down sped the Falcon, thence hasting like the wind he bore the Bold One. Then, wildly raging in his mind, the archer Krsanu aimed and loosed the string to strike him.

p: The Falcon bore him from $Heaven's lofty summit as the swift #car of @Indra's #Friend bore Bhujyu. Then downward hither fell a flying feather of the #Bird hasting forward in his #journey.

p: And now let @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu accept the beaker, white, filled with #milk, filled with the shining liquid; The best of sweet #meath which the monks have offered: that @Indra to his jo. May drink, the #Hero, that h. May take and drink it to his rapture.

hymns.title: HYMN XXVIII. Indra, indra, Varuna, and Mitra, Soma, Maghavan, Savitar, Visnu.
hymns.text:
p: ALLIED with thee, in this thy friendship, #Soma, @Indra for #man made #waters #flow together, Slew Ahi, and sent forth the Seven #Rivers, and opened as it were obstructed fountains.

p: @Indu, with thee for his confederate, @Indra swiftly with #might pressed down the wheel of @Surya. What rolled, all #life's support, on $Heaven's high summit was separated from the great oppressor.

p: @Indra smote down, @Agni consumed, O @Indu, the #Dasyus ere the noontide in the conflict. Of those who gladly sought a hard-won dwelling he cast down many a thousand with his arrow.

p: Lower than all besides hast thou, O @Indra, cast down the #Dasyus, abject tribes of Dasas. Ye drave away, ye put to #death the foemen, and took great vengeance with your murdering weapons.

p: So, of a truth, @Indra and #Soma. #Heroes, ye burst the stable of the kine and #horses, the stable which the bar or stone obstructed; and piercing through set free the habitations.

hymns.title: HYMN XXIX. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: COME, lauded, unto us with #powers and assists, O @Indra, with thy Tawny #Steeds; exulting, past even the foeman's manifold #libations, glorified with our hymns, true #Wealth-bestower.

p: #Man's #Friend, to this  'our #offering he cometh marking how he is called by #Soma-pressers. Fearless, and conscious that his #Steeds are noble, he joyeth with the #Soma-pouring #heroes.

p: Make his #cars hear, that h. May show his vigour an. May be joyful in the way he loveth. May #mighty @Indra pouring forth in bounty bestow on us good roads and perfect safety;

p: He who with assist comes to his implorer, the #singer here who with his #song invites him; He who himself sets to the pole swift Coursers, he who hath hundreds, thousands, Thunder-wielder.

p: O @Indra @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, by thee protecte. May we be thine, princes and monks and singers, Sharing the #riches sent from lofty $Heaven which yields much #food, and all desire its bounty.

hymns.title: HYMN XXX. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: O @Indra, @Vrtra conquerer, none is better, mightier than thou: Verily there is none like thee.

p: Like chariot-wheels these #people all together follow after thee: Thou ever art renowned as Great.

p: Not even all the gathered #Devas conquered thee, @Indra, in the war, when thou didst lengthen days by night.

p: When for the sake of those oppressed, and @Kutsa as he battled, Thou stolest away the #Sun's #car-wheel.

p: When, fighting singly, @Indra. thou o’ercamest all the furious #Devas, thou slewest those who strove with thee.

p: When also for a mortal #man, @Indra, thou speddest forth the #Sun, and holpest @Etasa with #might.

p: What? @Vrtra conquerer, art not thou, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, fiercest in thy wrath? So hast thou quelled the demon too.

p: And this heroic deed of #might thou, @Indra, also hast achieved, that thou didst smite to #death the Dame. $Heaven's Daughter, meditating ill.

p: Thou, @Indra, #Mighty One, didst crush @Usas, though Daughter of the $Sky. When lifting up herself in pride.

p: Then from her chariot @Usas fled, affrighted, from her ruined #car. When the #strong @Deva.had shattered it.

p: So there this #car of @Usas lay, broken to pieces, in Vipas, and she herself fled far away.

p: Thou, @Indra, didst. with magic power resist the overflowing #stream Who spread her #waters o’er the land.

p: Valiantly didst thou seize and take the store which @Susna had amassed, when thou didst crush his fortresses.

p: Thou, @Indra, also smotest down Kulitara's #son Sambara, the Dasa, from the lofty hill.

p: Of Dasa Varcin's thou didst subdue the hundred thousand and the five, Crushed like the fellies, of a #car.

p: So @Indra, #Lord of #Heroes, #powers, caused the unwedded damsel's #son, the castaway, to share the lauds.

p: So sapient @Indra, #Lord of #Might, brought @Turvasa and @Yadu, those Who feared the flood, in safety o’er.

p: Arna and Citraratha, both Aryas @Indra, slewest swift, On yonder side of Sarayu,

p: Thou, @Vrtra conquerer, didst conduct those two forlorn, the blind, the lame. Non. May attain this #bliss of thine.

p: For Divodasa, him who brought oblations, @Indra overthrew A hundred fortresses of stone.

p: The thirty thousand Dasas he with magic power and weapons sent To slumber, for Dabhiti's sake.

p: As such, O @Vrtra conquerer, thou art general #Lord of kine for all, Thou Shaker of all things that be.

p: @Indra, whatever deed of #might thou hast this day to execute, None be there now to hinder it.

p: O Watchful One. May @Aryaman the @Deva.give thee all goodly things. May @Pusan, @Bhaga, and the @Deva.Karulati give all things fair.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXI. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: WITH what #help will he come to us, wonderful, ever-waxing #Friend; With what most #mighty company?

p: What genuine and most liberal draught will #spirit thee with #juice to burst Open e’en strongly-guarded #wealth?

p: Do thou who art Protector of us thy #friends who #praise thee With hundred aids approach us.

p: Like as a courser's circling wheel, so turn thee hitherward to us, Attracted by the hymns of #men.

p: Thou seekest as it were thine own stations with swift descent of #powers: I share thee even with the #Sun.

p: What time thy courage and his wheels together, @Indra, run their course With thee and with the #Sun alike,

p: So even, #Lord of Power and #Might, the #people #call thee @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, Giver, who pauses not to think.

p: And verily to him who toils and presses #Soma #juice for thee Thou quickly givest ample #wealth.

p: No, not a hundred hinderers can check thy gracious bounty's #flow, Nor thy great deeds when thou wilt act.

p: May thine assistance keep us safe, thy hundred and thy thousand aids: May all thy favours strengthen us.

p: Do thou elect us this place for friendship and prosperity, and great celestial opulence.

p: Favour us, @Indra, evermore with overflowing store of #wealth: With all thy assists aid thou us.

p: With new protections, @Indra, like an archer, open thou for us The stables that are filled with kine.

p: Our chariot, @Indra, boldly moves endued with #splendour, ne’er repulsed, #Winning for us both kine and #steeds.

p: O @Surya, make our fame to be most #excellent among the #Devas, most lofty as the $Heaven on high.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: O THOU who slewest @Vrtra, come, O @Indra, hither to our side, #Mighty One with thy #mighty aids.

p: Swift and impetuous art thou, wondrous amid the well-dressed folk: Thou doest marvels for our #help.

p: Even with the weak thou smitest down him who is stronger, with thy strength The #mighty, with the #Friends thou hast.

p: O @Indra, we are close to thee; to thee we sing aloud our #songs: #Help and defend us, even us.

p: As such, O @Indra, come with thy assists wonderful, Blameless, and irresistible.

p: May we be #friends of one like thee, O @Indra, with the #wealth of kine, Comrades for lively energy.

p: For thou, O @Indra, art alone the #Lord of strength that comes from kine So grant thou us abundant #food.

p: They turn thee not another way, when, lauded, Lover of the #Song, Thou wilt give #wealth to those who #praise.

p: The #Gotamas have sung their #song of #praise to thee that tho. Mayst give, @Indra, for lively energy.

p: We will declare thy #hero deeds, what Dasa forts thou brakest down, Attacking them in rapturous #joy.

p: The sages sing those manly deeds which, @Indra, Lover of the #Song, Thou wroughtest when the #Soma flowed.

p: @Indra, the #Gotamas who bring thee praises have grown #strong by thee. Give them renown with #hero #sons.

p: For, @Indra, verily thou art the general #treasure. even of all . Thee, therefore, do we invocate.

p: #Excellent @Indra, turn to us: glad thee among us with the #juice Of Somas, #Soma-drinker thou.

p: May #praise from us who think Qn thee, O @Indra, bring thee near to us. Turn thy two Bay #Steeds hitherward.

p: Eat of our #offerings cake: rejoice thee in the #songs we sing. Even as a lover in his bride.

p: To India for a thousand #steeds well-trained and fleet of foot we meditate, and hundred jars of #Soma #juice.

p: We make a hundred of thy kine, yea, and a thousand, hasten nigh: So let thy bounty come to us.

p: We have obtained, a #gift from thee, ten #water-ewers wrought of #gold: Thou, @Vrtra conquerer, givest much.

p: A bounteous Giver, give us much, bring much and not a trifling #gift: Much, @Indra, wilt thou fain bestow.

p: O @Vrtra conquerer, thou art famed in many a place as bountiful #Hero, thy bounty let us share.

p: I #praise thy pair of Tawny #Steeds, #wise #Son of him who giveth kine Terrify not the cows with these.

p: Like two slight images of girls, unrobed, upon a new-wrought post, So #shine the Bay #Steeds in their course.

p: For me the Bays are ready when I start, or start not, with the @Dawn, innocuous in the ways they take.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXIII. Rbhus.
hymns.text:
p: I SEND my #voice as herald to the @Rbhus; I crave the white #cow for the overspreading. Wind-sped, the Skillful Ones in rapid motion have in an instant compassed round the $Heaven.

p: What time the Rbus had with care and marvels done proper service to assist their #Parents, they won the friendship of the #Devas; the Sages carried away the fruit of their devotion.

p: May they who made their #Parents, who were lying like posts that moulder, young again forever. May @Vaja, @Vibhvan, Rbhu, joined with @Indra , protect  'our #offering, the #Soma-lovers.

p: As for a year the @Rbhus kept the Milch-#cow, throughout a year fashioned and formed her body, and through a year's space still sustained her brightness, through these their labours they were made #immortal.

p: Two beakers let us make.thus said the eldest. Let us make three.this was the younger's sentence. Four beakers let us make.thus spoke the youngest. @Tvastar approved this rede of yours, O @Rbhus.

p: The #men spake truth and even so they acted: this Devalike way of theirs the @Rbhus followed. And @Tvastar, when he looked on the four beakers resplendent as the day, was moved with envy.

p: When for twelve days the @Rbhus joyed reposing as guests of him who neve. May be hidden, they made fair fertile fields, they brought the #rivers. Plants spread o’er deserts, #waters filled the hollows.

p: May they who formed the swift #car, bearing #Heroes, and the #Cow omniform and all-impelling, Eve. May they #form #wealth for us.the @Rbhus, dexterous-handed, deft in #work and gracious.

p: So in their #work the #Devas had satisfaction, pondering it with thought and mental insight. The #Devas’ expert artificer was @Vaja, @Indra's @Rbhuksan, @Varuna's was @Vibhvan.

p: They who made glad with #offering and praises, wrought the two Bays, his docile #Steeds, for @Indra. @Rbhus, as those who wish a #friend to prosper, bestow upon us gear and growth of #riches.

p: This day have they set gladdening drink before you. Not without toil are #Devas inclined to friendship. Therefore do ye who are so great, O @Rbhus, vouchsafe us #treasure.s at this third libation.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXIV. Rbhus.
hymns.text:
p: To this  'our #offering come Rbhu, @Vibhvan, @Vaja, and @Indra with the #gift of #riches, because this day hath @Dhisana the Devi set drink for you: the gladdening draughts have reached you.

p: Knowing your birth and rich in gathered #treasure., @Rbhus, rejoice together with the #Rtus. The gladdening draughts and wisdom have approached you: send ye us #riches with good store of #heroes.

p: For you was made this #offering, O @Rbhus, which ye, like #men, won for yourselves aforetime. To you come all who find in you their pleasure: ye all were—even the two elder—Vajas.

p: Now for the mortal #worshipper, O #Heroes, for him who served you, was the #gift of #riches. Drink, Vajas, @Rbhus! unto you is offered, to gladden you, the third and great libation.

p: Come to us. #Heroes, Vajas and Rbhuksans, glorified for the sake of #mighty #treasure.. These draughts approach you as the day is closing, as cows, whose calves are newly-#born, their stable.

p: Come to this #offering of ours, ye Children of Strength, invoked with #humble adoration. Drink of this #meath, #Wealth-givers, joined with @Indra with whom ye are in full accord, ye Princes.

p: Close knit with @Varuna drink the #Soma, @Indra; close-knit, #Hymn-lover! with the #Maruts drink it: Close-knit with drinkers first, who drink in season; close-knit with heavenly #Dames who give us #treasure.s.

p: Rejoice in full accord with the @Adityas, in concord with the #Parvatas, O @Rbhus; In full accord with @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, Divine One; in full accord with floods that pour forth #riches.

p: @Rbhus, who helped their #Parents and the @Asvins, who formed the Milch-#cow and the pair of #horses, Made armour, set the $Heaven and $Earth asunder.far- reaching #Heroes, they have made good #offspring.

p: Ye who have #wealth in booty, in #heroes, in rich sustenance and #treasure., Such, O ye @Rbhus, first to drink, rejoicing, give unto us and those who laud our present.

p: Ye were not far: we have not left you thirsting, blameless in this  'our #offering, O @Rbhus. Rejoice you with the #Maruts and with @Indra, with the #Kings, #Devas! that y. May give us #riches.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXV. Rbhus.
hymns.text:
p: Come hither, O ye #Sons of Strength, ye @Rbhus; stay not afar, ye Children of Sudhanvan. At this libation is your #gift of #treasure.. Let gladdening draughts approach you after @Indra's.

p: Hither is come the @Rbhus' #gift of #riches; here was the drinking of the well-pressed #Soma, Since by dexterity and skill as craftsmen ye made the single chalice to be fourfold 

p: Ye made fourfold the chalice that wag single: ye spake these words and said, O #Friend, assist us; Then, Vajas! gained the path of #life eternal, deft-handed @Rbhus, to the #Devas’ assembly.

p: Out of what substance was that chalice fashioned which ye made fourfold by your art and wisdom? Now for the gladdening draught press out the liquor, and drink, O @Rbhus, of die #meath of #Soma.

p: Ye with your cunning made your #Parents youthful; the cup, for #Devas to drink, ye formed with cunning; With cunning, @Rbhus, rich in #treasure., fashioned the two swift Tawny #Steeds who carry @Indra.

p: Whoso pours out for you, when days are closing, the sharp libation for your #joy, O Vajas, for him, O #mighty @Rbhus, ye, rejoicing, have fashioned #wealth with plenteous store of #heroes.

p: #Lord of Bay #Steeds, at @Dawn the #juice thou drankest: thine, only thine, is the noonday libation. Now drink thou with the #wealth-bestowing @Rbhus, whom for their skill thou madest #friends, O @Indra.

p: Ye, whom your artist skill hath raised to @Deva.ead have set you down above in $Heaven like falcons. So give us #riches, Children of Sudhanvan, O #Sons of Strength; ye have become #immortal.

p: The third libation, that bestoweth #treasure., which ye have won by skill, ye dexterous-handed. This drink hath been effused for you, O @Rbhus . drink it with high #delight, with #joy like @Indra's.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXVI. Rbhus.
hymns.text:
p: THE #car that was not made for #horses or for reins, three-wheeled, worthy of lauds, rolls round the $Firmament. That is the great announcement of your Deity, that, O ye @Rbhus, ye sustain the $Earth and $Heaven.

p: Ye Sapient Ones who made the lightly-rolling #car out of your mind, by thought, the #car that never errs, You, being such, to drink of this drink-#offering, you, O ye Vajas, and ye @Rbhus, we invoke.

p: O Vajas, @Rbhus, reaching far, among the #Devas this was your exaltation gloriously declared, in that your aged #Parents, worn with length of days, ye wrought again to youth so that they moved at will.

p: The chalice that wag single ye have made fourfold, and by your wisdom brought the #Cow forth from the hide. So quickly, mid the #Devas, ye gained #immortal #life. Vajas and @Rbhus, your great #work must be extolled.

p: #Wealth from the @Rbhus is most #glorious in renown, that which the #Heroes, famed for vigour, have produced. In synods must be sung the #car which @Vibhvan wrought: that which ye favour, #Devas! is famed among #mankind.

p: #Strong is the steed, the #man a #sage in eloquence, the bowman is a #hero hard to beat in fight, Great store of #wealth and manly power hath he obtained whom @Vaja, @Vibhvan, @Rbhus have looked kindly on.

p: To you hath been assigned the fairest ornament, the #hymn of #praise: Vajas and @Rbhus, #joy therein; For ye have lore and wisdom and poetic skill: as such, with this our #meditation we #call on you to come.

p: According to the wishes of our heart. May ye, who have full knowledge of all the delights of #men, Fashion for us, O @Rbhus, power and splendid #wealth, rich in high courage, #excellent, and vital strength.

p: Bestowing on us here #riches and #offspring, here fashion fame for us befitting #heroes. Vouchsafe us #wealth of splendid sort, O @Rbhus, that we may make us more renowned than others.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXVII. Rbhus.
hymns.text:
p: COME to  'our #offering, Vajas, Rbhuksans, #Devas, by the paths which #Devas are wont to travel, as ye, gay #Devas, accept in splendid weather  'the #offering among these folk of Manus.

p: May these rites please you in your heart and #spirit. May the #drops clothed in oil this day approach you. May the abundant juices bear you onward to power and strength, and, when imbibed, #delight you.

p: Your threefold going near is @Deva.appointed, so #praise is given you, Vajas and Rbhuksans. So, Manus-like, mid younger folk I offer, to you who are aloft in $Heaven, the #Soma.

p: #Strong, with fair chains of #gold and jaws of iron, ye have a splendid #car and well-fed #horses. Ye #Sons of Strength, ye #progeny of @Indra, to you the best is offered to #delight you.

p: Rbhuksans! him, for handy #wealth, the mightiest comrade in the fighthim, @Indra's equal, we invoke, most bounteous ever, rich in #steeds.

p: The mortal #man whom, @Rbhus, ye and @Indra favour with your #help, Must be successful, by his thoughts, at #offering and with the steed.

p: O Vajas and Rbhuksans, free for us the paths to #offering, Ye Princes, lauded, that we may press forward to each point of $Heaven.

p: O Vajas and Rbhuksans, ye @Nasatyas, @Indra, bless this #wealth, and, before other #men's, the steed, that ample riche. May be won.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXVIII. Dadhikris.
hymns.text:
p: FROM you two came the #gifts in days aforetime which Trasadasyu granted to the Purus. Ye gave the winner of our fields and plough-lands, and the #strong smiter who subdued the #Dasyus.

p: And ye gave #mighty #Dadhikras, the giver of many #gifts, who visiteth all #people, Impetuous hawk, swift and of varied colour, like a #brave #King whom each true #man must honour.

p: Whom, as ’twere down a precipice, swift rushing, each Puru praises and his heart rejoices. Springing forth like a #hero fain for battle, whirling the #car and flying like the tempest.

p: Who gaineth precious booty in the combats and moveth, #winning #spoil, among the #cattle; Shown in bright colour, looking on the assemblies, beyond the churl, to #worship of the living.

p: Loudly the folk cry after him in battles, as ’twere a thief who steals away a garment; Speeding to #glory, or a herd of #cattle, even as a hungry falcon swooping downward.

p: And, fain to come forth first amid these #armies, this way and that with rows of #cars he rushes, Gay like a bridesman, making him a garland, tossing the dust, champing the rein that holds him.

p: And that #strong Steed, victorious and faithful, obedient with his body in the combat, Speeding straight on amid the swiftly pressing, casts o’er his brows the dust he tosses upward.

p: And at his thunder, like the roar of $Heaven, those who attack tremble and are affrighted; For when he fights against embattled thousands, dread is he in his striving; non. May stay him.

p: The #people #praise the overpowering swiftness of this fleet Steed who giveth #men abundance. Of him they say when drawing back from battle. #Dadhikras hath sped forward with his thousands.

p: #Dadhikras hath o’erspread the Fivefold #People with vigour, as the #Sun lightens the #waters. May the #strong Steed who winneth hundreds, thousands, requite with sweetness these my words and praises.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXIX Dadhikras.
hymns.text:
p: Now give we #praise to #Dadhikras the rapid, and mention in our laud the $Earth and $Heaven. May the #Dawns flushing move me to exertion, and bear me safely over every trouble.

p: I #praise the #mighty Steed who fills my #spirit, the Stallion @Dadhikravan rich in bounties, whom, swift of foot and shining bright as @Agni, ye, @Varuna and @Mitra, gave to Purus.

p: Him who hath honoured, when the flame is kindled at break of @Dawn, the Courser Dadhikravanhim, of one mind with @Varuna and Mitr. May @Aditi make free from all transgression.

p: When we remember #mighty @Dadhikravan our #food and strength, then the blest name of #Maruts, @Varuna, @Mitra, we invoke for welfare, and @Agni, and the thunder-wielding @Indra.

p: Both sides invoke him as they #call on @Indra when they stir forth and turn to sacrificing. To us have @Varuna and @Mitra granted the Courser #Dadhikras, a guide for mortals.

p: So have I glorified with #praise #strong @Dadhikravan, conquering Steed. Swee. May he make our mouths. May he prolong the days we have to live.

hymns.title: HYMN XL. Dadhikravan.
hymns.text:
p: LET us recite the #praise of @Dadhikravan. May all the Mornings move me to exertion; #Praise of the #Lord of #Waters, @Dawn, and @Agni, @Narasamsa #Son of @Angiras, and @Surya.
